revised_title: Optical Properties of Semiconductor Nanoparticles: Synthesis and Applications
tldr: This article discusses the synthesis and investigation of the optical properties of semiconductor nanoparticles, specifically focusing on CdS nanoclusters. The authors describe the preparation process and the size-dependent optical properties of these nanoclusters, which are influenced by trapped charge carriers. They also explore the potential applications of these nanoparticles in nonlinear optics, as well as the formation of composite particles and dense nanoparticulate films.
